website_summaries.verdict: This is the best set of computer speakers available if you’d prefer to rely on a completely wired sound system, and the fact that Logitech’s speaker system is affordable and sports surprisingly good sound quality is the icing on the cake.
cons: There is no Wi-Fi or Bluetooth option, so you need to check if your devices are compatible before you buy

website_summaries.verdict: Terrific speakers that deliver 360-degree sound for crystal-clear audio time and time again.
pros: Offers 30 watts of power to deliver bold, full-range sound
Multiple inputs allow you to simultaneously connect your DVD player, iPod, and other devices to the speakers
Single volume control knob located on the right speaker ensures you can instantly adjust the speakers' volume
cons: Touching the audio input sometimes causes crackling and humming sounds
Volume level may jump around at times

website_summaries.verdict: Logitech's Z323 speakers project adequate sound at low levels, but if you turn up the volume, the audio has an unacceptable lack of clarity and severely distorted bass. We recommend that you stay away from these speakers and spend an extra $10 on the Logitech Z523, one of the best speaker-plus-subwoofer systems in its price class.
pros: RCA inputs lets you connect external audio sources
cons: Subwoofer is prone to distortion, even at half power

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Speaker System Z323 with Subwoofer ...
customer_reviews.text: Well, my cat chewed all of my 2002 HK speakers that worked great for 15 years. The Logitech Z323 with Subwoofer perform just as well or in most cases better than the $200 HK I bought 15 years ago. The cables from the Sub to the L&R speakers are longer than described, which worked out great for the location I have them in. These are great PC speakers, I was very surprised how well they sound for the money and size. Buy them, you won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice speaker system!
customer_reviews.text: Nice speaker system, got this as a gift for my son. Huge upgrade from the system he was using, some generic 2.1 setup with about 25w and an annoying buzz. It looked like it was straight outta 1991 or something! LOL Anyway, this Logitech setup sounds great, is plenty loud, looks modern, and we haven't noticed any annoying quirks, yet. I went with Logitech because I have several other products from them, including a Z906 500w RMS setup, which roars beautifully. I have come to trust the brand as high-quality products that outlast the competition 9 times outta 10! P.S. I was surprised at how rich and deep the bass gets for such a little subwoofer!
customer_reviews.author: Andy B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect with Alexa (AKA Echo)  Great deep, rich sound
customer_reviews.text: Got these to go with my Alexa (AKA Echo). I researched MANY other speakers at all kinds of prices. Got these because they are so similar to the Logitech Speakers (with Subwoofer) I already have on my computer. They have always had deep, rich sound. These were even better than expected. plugged right in and worked right away with Alexa. BEST BET for the money... or even form any speakers that would cost 80 to $90. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: V Champ

customer_reviews.title: Low quality
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for these speakers. The price is awesome and I expected a certain level of quality. However, these speakers sound pretty bad. If you even slightly turn the bass up it overtakes all other sound. The volume on the highest setting is pathetic, it’s only slightly louder than my iPhone volume. I would not recommend these speakers to anyone. Pay a little more and get some quality speakers. I’m really disappointed in Logitech this time around.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Will play full range and will do your music justice.
customer_reviews.text: Tested the Sound range with Ledisi "Stay Together" For R&B bass. Also tested with Disney's Fantasia for Orchestrial Range.. I now HATE my cars factory speakers bc i can now tell the difference between BOOM BOOM Bass and Intrumental Bass like upright bass, Bass Guitar, Trombones etc. I love Bass but I LOVE Orchestral and Intrumental music with the FULL Range of sounds. This speaker WILL do your music justice. BOOM BOOM as well as full ranged music. I am a music enthusiast not audiophile/band director.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Erlanger

customer_reviews.title: Speakers Suck DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: If I still had the box they came in I would send them back. Kids were to quick to clean (first time ever!). There is to much bass in these speakers and everything just sounds like shit. I have tried turning down the base and turning up the little speakers and there is no "Happy Medium"
customer_reviews.author: thomas

customer_reviews.title: Subwoofer makes death rattle
customer_reviews.text: I got these up and working in 5 minutes, but the subwoofer makes a horrible rattle noise once you turn the sound up past 1/3rd volume. Not even remotely acceptable. Went online and found a CNET review which told me two things: it is unfixable; and it happened during their test run too (although their rattle didn't happen until volume was at 1/2). I am sorry I ordered these speaker as it appears from other reviews that they are very prone to this problem during manufacture. And I guess Logitech doesn't try detecting this during quality check.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Muddy mids.
customer_reviews.text: These sound bad. So bad I rarely listen. The set I had before? ...that I wanted to upgrade? Way better than these Logitechs.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the speaker system for my desktop and honestly went initially with Logitech because of my past experiences with them. However, I am so impressed with the purchase!! If you are looking for a speaker system for your desktop, this IS the system for you to buy! It's easy to install, has a AWESOME sound, an included sub woofer, and the speakers don't fall over. The speakers are not top heavy and the cords are long if you want to hide with a twisty. They also have a easy to access input for a iPod or iPhone if you want to use them for music as well.
customer_reviews.author: Elise

customer_reviews.title: These would have been great speakers if I could get them to work!
customer_reviews.text: These would have been great speakers if I could get them to work! This was the second set of Logitech speakers I bought, the problem I was having is that only one speaker would work at a time. I tried them on two different computers with the same results as well as the other set. The set I already owed does the same thing. I do have a set of Logitech speakers that also have a subwoofer but isn't adjustable for the base and they work fine on both computers. I contacted Logitech for support on their website never heard back after a week so I sent them back. I bought speakers from a different manufacturer that work great
customer_reviews.author: Mrmom9

customer_reviews.title: If You Buy These- You won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: These are GREAT sounding speakers. They are 2.1 set up, comparable to a 5.1. The 360 degree sound, I didn’t quite understand that concept. But now I do. The sound has a lot of depth, making Netflix a lot better to watch on my computer. I’m happy I bought this set, rather than the less expensive 313, that I also considered. This set has great quality sound is well worth paying a few more dollars for this set. But of course, logitech is a reliable name, that is well known good quality products. So I have high expectations from Logitech. But Logitech, managed to exceed my expectations on these speakers. I’m very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara B

customer_reviews.title: Z323 Speakers
customer_reviews.text: I've used Logitech speakers before and never had issues. This is no exception. Arrived with no issues and that feeling when you peel away the plastic was great. Sounds awesome, little deeper than most other speakers so adjust your base per your system. I did end up placing my speakers and sub woofer on top of my table as opposed to sub woofer on the floor. I have neighbors downstairs and I felt that the sub woofer, which has its speaker pointing down vs to the side, would be too loud. But even with it on my desk, it sounds great. Can't really complain with something that just works.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Cornell

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this speaker set up
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this speaker set up! I have been using 15 year old Logitech speakers for the last... Well... 15 years. They were still working perfectly fine but I decided to see what was new out there in the world of sound. These blew my mind! So much that I even got a stereo system for my TV! The subwoofer is amazing for just $40! At half volume I can hear (and feel) any sound from anywhere in my house. It definitely makes cleaning a lot more fun - just jam out with some blasting EDM :P I'll definitely recommend this to anyone looking for solid sound on a budget. Gaming is also wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Lizz Southern

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Z323
customer_reviews.text: My main computer speakers. Bass unit is turned down to balance it. I have had these for nearly a year now. Excellent sound quality for the price. Do not use these if your intention is to properly balance and mix music. Adequate for light video and audio editing.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin TolentinoTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality, very good bass
customer_reviews.text: This computer speaker really does turn your computer, laptop, or phone into an entertainment system. No, it's not surround sound, but the sound quality is very good, and the bass is impressive. I hooked this up to a computer in the lighting controller at my church, where I use it to listen to the music as I set up the lighting looks that go with it. A number of times, someone has walked by and commented, "Woah, do you have a subwoofer in there?" Yes, yes I do.
customer_reviews.author: T. Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Poor equalization
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after the other set of Logitech speakers I had finally died. I've always had good luck with Logitech, but unfortunately these speakers do not sound as good as I hoped. As others have commented, the bass is too much. The speakers sound somewhat hollow, there's no balance. I probably won't reurn them because compared to my laptop's speakers, they are a big step up, and I need them. However, I don't recommend them. Next time I'll buy another set of Edifiers.
customer_reviews.author: ncbookgal

customer_reviews.title: Handsome, well built, inexpensive, compact speaker system with good sound quality. Excellent value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Everything you need is in the box. Setup is quick and easy. Took about ten minutes to unpack and position the speakers to my liking. I plugged the 3.5 mic jack into my TV. Did have to wiggle it a bit to get a good connection. Turned the speaker volume up and adjusted the bass response on the subwoofer to my liking. I learned that the sound becomes clearer and louder when the bass is turned down instead of up. Everything sounds very good to my ears and I can easily adjust the volume with the TV's remote. I will be ordering a second set of these speakers for use with my iMac.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie G

customer_reviews.title: Not bad not great, just ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's okay, the sound is not what I expected. I figured there would be a little more clarity with highs and mids and the base sounds a little muffled. I replaced a 10 year old dell 3 piece computer speaker setup, figureing it would be better but in reality it is not. For the price though, not bad. Maybe a Bose system would sound better but then again you are getting what you paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Loud,rich, bass
customer_reviews.text: I like these. The bass is adjustable. But the sound quality is too good? I often adjust bass for difference songs. I kinda miss my old z21(??) whatever the cheaper model is this with the weird wired remote These really do have power! When I have bass adjusted correctly i really live these! For the 6$ more part of me regrets paying it. The less Powerful ones with the wires remote were comfortable... The added power but the fact I have to Fiddle with em is a pain Maybe my requirements are unique . These are loud and clear Good speakers
customer_reviews.author: stever68A

customer_reviews.title: Great computer speakers - lasted over 6 years!
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchase these Logitech speakers for my desktop computer back in 2012 - so after playing thousands of Youtube videos and even more of streaming music, the left speaker finally stopped working after 6 years of use. I can honestly say it has been one of - if not the longest lasting electronic-related item I've ever owned and up until it gave out - it sounded great, much better than most of the new expensive portable bluetooth speakers that last a year or two at most. I will be buying the same exact set again to replace the old one back on my desktop.
customer_reviews.author: BikeGuy

customer_reviews.title: 90% great, 10% garbage
customer_reviews.text: These speakers work fine most of the time, but once a week they'll just spontaneously develop a problem. Sometimes they will just start making this droning sound totally unrelated to audio input. Sometimes the volume level just jumps around, with the same audio input. Just now the right speaker stopped outputting any sound whatsoever, but still acts as the pass through for the computer just fine (left speaker works great). Overall, an endless stream of problems.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I am replacing an old set of beige Altec Lansing computer speakers that I had for years but they finally died. Those speakers were amazing. These are just OK... I am sure these are fine for basic, everyday use but they just don't seem to be loud enough for when you went to let your hair down and rock out. The subwoofer is very weak and muddy even though it does have its own volume control. Cable length is decent and the price is good but keep your expectations realistic.
customer_reviews.author: joeg

customer_reviews.title: They work...
customer_reviews.text: These were an emergency replacement for a set from Cyber Acoustics that sounded great but over the years we've had multiple failures from their volume pucks so we decided to try Logitech in the same price range... They work. They aren't bad but... They don't have the sound quality the Cyber Acoustics units have had, nor the volume. If you're supplementing a laptop they'll be great, if you're deciding to try Logitech from another brand, read reviews and go from there. If you're coming from crappy stereo speakers, not bad, the sub will give some low end that you haven't had before.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sink

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I used to have same brand of "logitech satellite" speakers from nearly 15 years ago, I loved them but eventually gave out, I couldn't find the exact same model and these were the closest to them... not bad but certainly feel cheaper, I had to fasten a rubber band to the volume knob as it's difficult to turn w/out something that offers friction to turn (knob is flat polished plastic, slips easily). Turning the volume high and you can hear white noise, not bad but certainly not as good as what Logitech used to deliver 10+ years ago
customer_reviews.author: EPB

customer_reviews.title: A solid Logitech unit.
customer_reviews.text: I had previous experience with a 2.1 system from Logitech, and wanted to buy a set for my SO for Christmas. This set works much better than any built in speaker on a monitor. (as you would hope.) The little subwoofer puts in a respectable amount of work and the overall sound is really nice for the price. Can definitely recommend for anyone looking to amp up a desktop setup without spending too much. [Don't waste money on a really cheap set as you'll end up disappointed-- something like this set works perfect for a relatively cheap option.]
customer_reviews.author: Rwarcards762

customer_reviews.title: From Z200 to Z323
customer_reviews.text: So I got these speakers during the Cyber Monday Sale. Got it for half the original cost and I have to say, I really like the product. It's got nice quality sound for the price and the subwoofer addition makes it sound a lot better. I would say if you're looking at these speakers during the sale, get them. If you miss the sale, save up for an even nicer quality speaker like Bose. I had the Z200 speakers and they were good for the price, but upgrading it to the Z323, you'll hear the difference in sound.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Price for Quality. THIS IS IT!
customer_reviews.text: For the size of the subwoofer, it produces good amount of bass. If you are looking into this for the Bass, I would go with the next step up. Logitech Z623 or the Logitech Z906 would a better option, the Z906 is more tailored for entertainment systems with it's 7.1 Channel 6 speakers 1 sub. It will Make movies or Gaming an Experience. That being said. I have used the z323 for almost 18months and have not regretted a single penny. I am a Gamer, Audiophile, Recording Artist, Streamer, and Movie Enthusiast. It has Satisfied all my needs.
customer_reviews.author: myonlyotaku

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest clarity in the mids and very highs
customer_reviews.text: Not the greatest clarity in the mids and very highs, but great base and for the price you can't beat these speakers. I would definitely recommend them as a great starter speaker set
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Coffey

customer_reviews.title: Sound not so clear.
customer_reviews.text: I understand that these are inexpensive speakers, but I thought they would be better. They have plenty of bass and good volume control, my issue is with the highs and mid-range. They seem somewhat muddy or muffled even with the bass turned way down. Also, be very careful when picking up the sub-woofer there is no cover on the speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Quincy

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a whole lot to say about these other than they perform as expected! The bass is decent and adjustable, and one of the best things has to be that each speaker has a dedicated wire of its own, allowing you to space them comfortably apart on your desk without tugging on the wires. The speakers really do blast, and the bass is full and rich, giving lots of boom with just a little bit of volume. Once you dial in the sound you'll love em. Best bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: sounds low especially for voices.
customer_reviews.text: i personally think you should spend a little extra money and get better speakers. the voices sound low compared tot the back ground noise. even when raising the volume, you just get louder explosions, car crashes etc while barely being able to hear what actors are saying. music has been fine on these.
customer_reviews.author: angel

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, fair price, used as small room computer speakers.
customer_reviews.text: I purchase these for occasionals music listening, and school lectures/ presentation audio. I would not go so far as to say that these speakers blow the door open with sound quality, bass, or volume, but for the price they are a quality upgrade from stock monitor/ computer speakers. Volume does have to be turned up to about 50% to hear much of anything clearly though, but has been consistent with that threshold. Only suggestion I would make is to put the bass control on next to the sound volume control rather so than on the Subwoofer, a bit inconvenient to go behind the desk to alter the level.
customer_reviews.author: Xander Davis

customer_reviews.title: Best 40$ bucks I’ve spent in awhile!
customer_reviews.text: If you’re looking for a good sounding Computer or gaming monitor speakers I would highly recommend giving these a try, I don’t think you will be disappointed. They are not stereo high quality speakers but you will be shocked at the sound quality and volume. This is one of those products you add to the “Best Purchase” category for $40 bucks. I must say I was shocked after hooking them up, nice warm tones and the sub fills in the bass area nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Steinmann

customer_reviews.title: Works after some effort.
customer_reviews.text: Had constant bass static when first arrive. After messing with my sound settings and sound drivers for a while I got that to go away but it was a bit of a headache. Now only problem is I can't have my phone on my desk or after a while which ever speaker it's close to will start getting static. After some trial and error I finally got them to work fine and they sound great compared to my previous cheaper 2.1 pc speakers. Happy with them just wish I didn't have to mess with all that and leave my phone on my bed from now on when at PC. Still sound great though so 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: computer speaker
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a Logitech set I had for several years. They were safely packed, not damaged, so that is a plus there. When I set them up I could not get anything but a weird pulsing noise....not sure but I think the plug in on the computer is going bad. If I have the cord propped up on the woofer thing it works fine. Maybe I didn't need a new one as Logitech makes great products...but oh well, I might try hooking up the old one to my laptop....
customer_reviews.author: Catherine F.

customer_reviews.title: Poor wires pick up everything
customer_reviews.text: Speakers are nice and loud, the subwoofer is even a little surprising. However the main audio cable is so wimpy and shielded that it picks up everything, every time I use my mouse or keyboard, or even bump the wire I hear a loud static sounds when the speakers are turned up. Had to totally isolate the wires and they still pick up interference. Certain pitches and sounds in music seem to make the speakers crackle when they are over about 50% volume, which is pretty loud btw.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Sharp sound, good quality
customer_reviews.text: I recently got a nice desktop computer and wanted some good gaming and music sound. I'm a bit of an audiophile. The bass is actually quite powerful and the speakers look fancy and expensive but the price is pretty on point. The volume knob doesn't feel flimsy and the cords have enough slack to set it up any way you'd like. Definitely recommend! I am NOT PAID to write reviews
customer_reviews.author: J. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Unexpectedly Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: I normally listen to music in my office on RBH headphones but decided to get PC speakers for listening to general news or when I want a murmur of background music. I just installed the Z323 and happened to have a Chopin piano concerto cued up. I was immediately taken with the clarity and nuance. Lower notes are just a tiny bit muddy but midrange and high frequencies are crisp and true. For what this system cost I am absolutely flabbergasted. Well done, Logitech!
customer_reviews.author: James Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Okay for the price, but lacking full treble sound
customer_reviews.text: These are some basic Logitech speakers, but even at this price point I feel they are lacking in clarity compared to the old pair of Creative speakers that they replaced. Perhaps the lack of independent tweeters is the cause of the problem, but either way they are very biased towards the low end of the audio spectrum and I had to tweak with my equalizer settings just to make them sound okay. My advice? Spend another $20 and get a 2.1 setup that has better full-range response.
customer_reviews.author: raggedtoad

customer_reviews.title: Only 1 speaker per tower!
customer_reviews.text: These look like they contain 2 speakers per tower. However they only have 1 per tower. I thought seeing they were Logitech, they would perform like an older set of Logitech I had. ( push power button broke) they sounded way better! Bass speaker was much better too! Should have just left the old ones on all the time! Would not purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Terry L. Pettett

customer_reviews.title: Muddy Sound
customer_reviews.text: I bought these speakers to replace my ancient Harman Kardon speakers that constantly pick up radio noise. It took me about 15 minutes to set the Z323 up crawling under my desk and running cords. In about 10 minutes of testing the sound with a movie, a song, and a youtube video I was back to crawling under my desk top unplug everything and return the product. The bass was loud but voices came through noticeably muddy. It was physically uncomfortable to listen to even when I fiddled with my computer settings and the bass nob to balance out the sound. I have heard a lot better from many equally inexpensive speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Roberge

customer_reviews.title: Great sound; touchy bass control; overall very good system
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Completely as advertized; good, solid bass; good connectibility; can be balanced, but is not the easiest; very good overall sound quality; would make for an acceptable home audio solution on a budget Cons: no equalizer or driver support (not that it was expected); very touchy, nonlinear (maybe logarithmic) bass control; only 2 channel audio with control over the subwoofer (don't expect 5.1 or 7.1 control or quality, but a very good 2 channel speaker); easy to be obnoxious in an apartment setting with the sub, but it's still enjoyable at low levels
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Gooch

customer_reviews.title: Love these speakers
customer_reviews.text: I think these speakers are great! I read some reviewers who didn't agree, and I really don't understand. The bass is great, thumpy and adjustable. They're really loud. I was shocked at how loud they are for their compact size and I can't hear any feedback. They definitely made my windows shake on full volume. I love that they don't take up much room. If you want an awesome set of speakers for home use, I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: DS1210

customer_reviews.title: The satellites sound excellent. I bought these to replace crappy tv speakers
customer_reviews.text: Logitech has been a solid company ever since I was a kid. All their products have went above and beyond my expectations. These are no exception. the bass knob I almost have to turn all the way down. It's surprising what a little 20watt 4" sub can do. The satellites sound excellent. I bought these to replace crappy tv speakers. It is 100 times better don't let the price fool you. If you want more ground shaking bass and crystal clear highs go with the z623 line up. Soundbars take up too much room, the price and is lame, and come on no audio quality for the price let's be real.
customer_reviews.author: Lu

customer_reviews.title: ROCK  OUT  with this  bad boy !!!
customer_reviews.text: Oh YES. We bought the Logitech SQUEEZEBOX speaker system to replace the a very well used ,smaller speaker set. The units are well designed, manufactured, with the master volume dial on the front of the RIGHT master speaker. The headphone and and device plugs are also on the side of the Right MASTER speaker. The SUB-WOOFER volume dial is on the BACK of the Sub-Woofer. The system has a Very DEEP, rich, full wall shaking sound. Now if only Logitech would add multi-colored, strobe effect LED lighting to the front of these , that would elevate the whole experience even more. But as is, this product is still a VERY High Quality item. KenC and TimO in Texas!!
customer_reviews.author: KC and TO

customer_reviews.title: This system puts more boom in my bass!
customer_reviews.text: I just installed this speaker with subwoofer system on my computer and I love it! Lots of bass and more than loud enough for my needs. Other reviews mentioned the bass control is on the back of the subwoofer, so I was prepared for that when hooking it up, and put the subwoofer where I could easily reach the control on the back. I play electric guitar and bass and I was looking for a speaker system with more bass so I could practice bass along with my Amazing Slowdowner program, and this system is perfect. Super easy to install, no special software required. Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Noorah101

customer_reviews.title: I'm returning these speakers - the subwoofer doesn't work right
customer_reviews.text: Yesterday, I opened the box containing these speakers and tried to use them with my iPhone X. The small satellite speakers worked good, but the subwoofer made a loud crackling sound continually. I tried different volumes, and connection/cables (as the instructions stated). Nothing worked. Today, I tried using my 2018 MacBook Pro. Identical results to the iPhone. These speakers should never have passed any quality inspection before shipment. I returning them, and will try speakers from a different manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Chip71

customer_reviews.title: Mids and Highs are Great...
customer_reviews.text: This set replaced an Altec Lansing set that finally died. I had high hopes for it based on the generally good reviews. I miss the good clean bass from my Altec system, but the highs and mids on the satellite speakers are great. O well, sound is fine for my classroom and for the money I suppose it's a good deal. I appreciate that the wires are long enough to fit my application and set up was super quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: CBro

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install; weird sound in bass occasionally
customer_reviews.text: Overall the system came very easy to set up and make ready to listen to anything I needed. For the price, the sound quality was pretty decent. After a couple days, the bass speaker starts to make a weird sound once in a while--like a thumping that doesn't stop. I can pause everything, unplug aux cable, and it continues until I unplug the power. And once I plug it back in (also continues if I turn off, without unplugging), it will continue for a short duration until it suddenly stops, and I don't know why. Might have to return it in a week or so if it continues.
customer_reviews.author: Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and great for noise masking
customer_reviews.text: These are great affordable speakers. They’re also the only reason my sig fig and I get any sleep. Our upstairs neighbors walk like frightened elephants and we’ve tried all other noise canceling methods. Fans, machines, smaller speaker. You name it, we tried it short of replacing our ceiling in a rented apartment. Used these with Brownian noise and problem solved. The sub woofer easily masks the heavy footfall sounds of the neighbors who scoffed at the suggestion of us getting them some carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A whole new world! (of sound)
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a better set of speakers for my computer because my last ones were basic old ones. Not only was this an upgrade but the sound from this blessed piece of equipment filled and changed the entire atmosphere of the area I had it in as if it were magic. I don't have a a lot to compare it to but if you have cheap or default speakers these will change your life! ( I know I'm a little over the top, but yes they're great speakers in my opinion )
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: great speakers
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use in a large room at school, nothing I had was loud enough. These were easy to set up, don't take up a lot of space, and sound amazing. They are so loud we actually had to turn the volume down.
customer_reviews.author: S. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Decent Speakers for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these speakers to replace the Logitech speakers that I bought 25 years ago and had finally died. My old speakers came with a much better subwoofer that connected to the computer via HDMI. I was hoping the new ones would have that option, so I could still use the old subwoofer. The sound quality on the new ones are decent but not the most amazing. That being said, they get the job done for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Jernigan

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nothing crazy, good crisp sound. For the price it's amazing. The biggest flaw is the audio in is big my phone wont even recognize it, and its also permanent meaning once the input wire has a bad connection as always happens eventually, you have to buy a new one or use the aux dual input. For the price though can just buy another one after a year or 2 no sweat.
customer_reviews.author: jon

customer_reviews.title: Very good speakers for the price.
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are FANTASTIC. Within 5 minutes of setting it up and pulling up a song on my computer, it blew me out of the water. Sounds are very clear, loud, and the bass can be as punchy as you want it to be with the sub-woofer control knob. It's very easy to set up and looks great on the desk. Good stuff Logitech, will definitely recommend to friends and family!
customer_reviews.author: Banhi Banhi

customer_reviews.title: Best system you're going to find under 50 bucks
customer_reviews.text: Best system you're going to find under 50 bucks! Handles low freq. very well. Very important to me that it has an independent subwoofer volume control so that I can turn off the sub late at night to not disturb my room-mates. I gave it 4 instead of 5 because it handles mid and treble decently (not nearly as well as lows). Thus, it lacks a certain clarity. Again, what are you expecting for under 50 bucks, this ain't Bose, it's logictech.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony DePasquale

customer_reviews.title: OK while they lasted
customer_reviews.text: Three stars for 14 months of use until they died. These speakers power sound for my laptop. The sound is excellent for the cost, strong bass and good high tones. 'Audiophiles need not apply' because I'm sure there are much better speakers but at a higher price point. Now, 14 months after purchase and after moving to clear my desk, the speakers have completely stopped. There is a simple wiring and that has been checked and rechecked in a new location. Time to toss them. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective used like new speakers
customer_reviews.text: I bought them used like new. I don't feel hardly any air coming out of the subwoofer. The speakers are loud sometimes and sometimes they kind of soft but louder than the speaker built into the monitor. There must be a loose wire but it looked like the saran wrap sticker coating that was on the speakers meant they had never been used. I saw the same ones brand new in the box for 3 dollars more than the used like new ones on Amazon at Wal Mart. This is one of the very rare cases Wal Mart has a better price on.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Kennison

customer_reviews.title: Love this little system!
customer_reviews.text: Oooh I love this system! It's REALLY easy to set up and the sound is really crisp and lovely! It was important to me to have control on the woofer and this has that. My old speakers were so crappy, I had to replay all my songs again just to remember how good they actually are! lol SO worth the money. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: cheetocheeto

customer_reviews.title: but never dropped onto the floor or anything like that. I had same issue before
customer_reviews.text: The left speaker stopped working after a few months. It got knocked over on my desk once or twice, but never dropped onto the floor or anything like that. I had same issue before, but was fine with it cause it happened after a significant period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Drenning

customer_reviews.title: It's quite annoying.
customer_reviews.text: Works decently, but I have a lot of issue with noise in these speakers that I haven't had in previous logitech speakers. The higher you turn up the volume on the speakers themselves, the louder buzzing noise I get. I've tried messing with the subwoofer and checking cables are plugged in well or giving them a bit of slack but nothing seems to get rid of it. It's quite annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah M Sherer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sound Quality - Better than Bose and half the price.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my husband's boat repair shop. We use them to play Sirius XM from the computer. The sound quality and stereo effect are excellent. I'm actually buying a second set and a splitter, so we can hook up speakers outside in the carport service bays. Just as a note........ I bought a set of Bose speakers as well. The sound doesn't even come close, and the Bose speakers were double the price.
customer_reviews.author: C Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Best Speakers! Bought my Dad the same ones.
customer_reviews.text: My dad was complaining about the sound of his computer speakers so I just ordered another pair of these and sent directly to him. First of all, he was very surprised to get the package. Secondly, he can’t believe the sound that these produce.. These speakers have Great sound with adjustable bass. You can’t get a better sounding pair of speakers at this price. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Considering price, these speakers deliver outstanding quality. The bass subwoofer is terrific. It has its own volume and I had to turn it down a little. This is a 60 watt set and i believe it is competitive with a 100 watt system I had on my living room floor speakers. Can't be more pleased with it. Took me less than 30 minutes to unpack and install and I am a dunce when it comes to computer connections. When I first turned it on, the subwoofer made a horrible noise. I did not notice the plastic cling wrap was covering the speaker. Duh!! It was the plastic wrap vibrating. You will not be disappointed with this speaker system!!.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Worth The Price
customer_reviews.text: The speakers came in a day early, were fairly small and very easy to setup. I'm impressed by the amount of bass it's actually putting out and am enjoying the over all sound quality. For 40-50$ speakers it's a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Sinbane

customer_reviews.title: Re-Thinking My Prime Membership, etc.
customer_reviews.text: Right Channel Speaker stopped working after 3-days with no rough-stuff. Return arrangements are strenuous for a Prime customer.
customer_reviews.author: MisterEd

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for the price for at-home desk PC
customer_reviews.text: Great for price for at-home desk PC, everything is nice and compact..my desk doesnt have extra space with 3 screens. Sounds is great! Impressed by the little sub especially, it kicks pretty well and I can just tuck it under the desk. I downloaded a free sound equalizer (Equalizer APO) onto my PC to balance out the sound, and I must say, Im impressed for $45..You aint gonna beat it! The equalizer makes a good difference, just FYI.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Kudika

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Really liked this product. I purchased the "cheap" speakers from another brand, but had terrible quality. This has a solid structure, great bass and quality sound, enough to fill up my classroom (I'm a teacher). Much better purchase than going the completely low-cost route.
customer_reviews.author: Kayli Hillebrand

customer_reviews.title: Name Brand with Good History - Not great sound.  :-(
customer_reviews.text: Delivery and packaging excellent. Person is hard of hearing and needed good sounding speakers for computer. Disappointing as in years past bought same brand of speakers and did terrific job. This time, ok. Have to return and try again. Must have something for disabled hearing that does not cost hundreds of dollars. Thought Logitech would be it. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: and they have delivered great sound for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've had these speakers for over 3 years, and they have delivered great sound for the price. But recently the left speaker started to short out, and I think the problem is in the volume knob. I suspect turning them on and off over the years has caused the problem, now I just disconnect the power cord and leave the knob turned on, but it still shorts out, so I'm looking for a new set. My advice is, don't turn off the volume knob, and these speakers may last a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: Curt

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful sound with Sound Blaster Sound Card
customer_reviews.text: It is amazing. replaced my monitor speakers... then replaced my Bluetooth speakers... and now the Z323. There is no comparison. My wife complains that I have it too loud, but it sounds SO GOOD! I use a Sound Blaster Card and it is amazing. Very clear and the subwoofer is a nice add. The speakers themselves actually have their own decent BASS too. If I turn it up, you can hear across the entire house, with clarity.
customer_reviews.author: Chris W

customer_reviews.title: Good for surround sound with PC or TV
customer_reviews.text: They sound quality is pretty good. I would recommend that you turn the sub-woofer on a low setting though. The main sub-woofer with sub-woofers(subs) on each speaker, it can drown out some of the talking or singing being played through it. It will cover a large area's range. I personally use it for gaming and it makes the games sound way more realistic along with a bass that will vibrate the walls when turned up. If you live in an apartment, definitely turn the bass down.
customer_reviews.author: GDoggett

customer_reviews.title: Great volume. Terrible sound.
customer_reviews.text: I love Logitech products but these speakers were extremely disappointing. I know they aren't high quality but wow. First set I had the speaker did work on the right. Even my wife walked in the door and said "omg this sounds horrible". It's hollow and drowned out. My 15$ Bluetooth sounds way better. Sad experience.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Jerrell

customer_reviews.title: Nice speakers for the money, great value.
customer_reviews.text: SOund is great for desktop speakers, nice looking and easy to hook up. One small issue is the signal jack from the speakers to the computer (green plug 3.5mm) can cause feed back if wiggled in the computer socket, not a very good connection but you use what you got, it works, but just dont bump it or you can get horrible buzz sound through the speakers. All in all they are very nice speakers and great value with good sound.
customer_reviews.author: Kudzu

customer_reviews.title: Great, just Great
customer_reviews.text: Dude, I love these things. I'm not sponsored or anything but I appreciate music and the audio equipment that plays it. And these things sure satisfy me. The bass, first of all, is amazing. The sub woofer is great and gives out overwhelming bass. I put it at half, because at full it blasts away through the bottom floor. If other reviews are saying the bass gave out, its because they used it chaotically. Use it gently and it will not disappoint you. Yes, it does have a weird cord for the other speaker, but who cares! It is such a masterpiece of a speaker that is affordable! I can't recommend highly enough. These works wonders.
customer_reviews.author: Wotomogo

customer_reviews.title: I don't think I could have done better for the price. Great sound!
customer_reviews.text: If you can get past the visual design of the speakers (maybe it's just me), these things are great! Easy to set up, no pesky USB connections to deal with, and oh so clean sound. I can't fathom the need for the highest setting on the subwoofer, because around 25% is PLENTY. Are there nicer sound setups? Sure. But all around very pleased with how I spent my money.
customer_reviews.author: Indigo

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I am ecstatically happy with my Logitech speakers. My computer speakers "died", I had just moved and I needed new speakers desperately. BUT, I was low on funds. I found these speakers at Amazon for a very reasonable price, and I couldn't be MORE please with the quality of the speakers. Thank You, Logitech!
customer_reviews.author: Sue Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers for the price
customer_reviews.text: overall a 5 for the price. Volume easy to control, base is super good and easy to setup. The only problem is this is my second system as the first arrived damaged. Replaced and yet another small crush on the base however not bad enough to return. Packaging is poor at best so inspect carefully when it arrives.
customer_reviews.author: Don't Worry, Bee Happy

customer_reviews.title: very nice "durable" speaker & sound as you would expect from logitech....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on Feb 2, 2017- it was used continuously every day for a almost 2 years now.. & was even ripped out kicked down a "concrete basement stairs" (by an angry family member of mine through a burst of "rage" xD) but was able to survive that abuse & still sounds like brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.bedazzled

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use with one of my Echo Dots. The sound quality is good, but not great. I needed something that would fill a large room with sound. It is good for small to medium rooms, however I would go with something a little different for larger rooms. That being said, I have never had a bad purchase with Logitech products.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Speakers
customer_reviews.text: I just use these speakers to listen to music (SiriusXM) on my computer when I am working or fooling around. They are a big improvement over the Dell speakers that came with it. The subwoofer adds just a nice little touch of base. For the price I paid I think they were a bargain. Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A SOLID system at a decent price point
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get my wife a nice speaker setup for her laptop docking station and this one seemed to have a comfortable price. I'm glad I got it! The sound is deep and vibrant. I've tested some movies on it and it sounds great for this setup. At this price, I'd say you could do a lot worse.
customer_reviews.author: LAWJR3

customer_reviews.title: The greatest “computer speakers” ever !
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used these once before in 2014 I think, and they were good then, but I had listened to JBL studio monitors with music and Mackies and all sorts of high grade professional speakers, so I was skeptical about these and thought they wouldn’t sound right to my ear anymore, but I ordered them in August and plugged them all up, put on some music, they sound good from music like Eminem, 50 Cent, Future to music like Slayer, Megadeth, and Van Halen If you’re looking for some low budget speakers that kick major a**, I would definitely recommend these to be your buy !
customer_reviews.author: Chris Alia

customer_reviews.title: Good system, excellent value
customer_reviews.text: My main quibble with this system is the bass control. It's located on the subwoofer, which makes it hard to adjust for different types of program material, and the control curve is not very smooth. Having said that, the overall sound (once you adjust the bass appropriate to the program material) is excellent for the size and price point, and the sub is capable of putting out powerful yet clear bass.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality w/ easy volume & bass control
customer_reviews.text: Love these speakers, had some very old ones prior and what an upgrade. From volume control/quality to the bass is just phenomenal. Not to forget, just having a port on the speaker is a game changer for headphones. If you're looking for an affordable set of speakers, look for further. Also the sleek look is a nice addition.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Good speakers for the money
customer_reviews.text: They preform at least as good as the price they cost... actually better. But don't dream that these provide high quality sound. They serve the purpose at my desktop. I like them. Plenty of bass, again for the money. Adaptable to various configurations and purposes. Input and output on right speaker... maybe iPod input and earbud output. Bass speaker has auxiliary input too.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo Divine

customer_reviews.title: Very Bad, Do Not BUY< Not Linear At All, Refund Reviews  Are Crap
customer_reviews.text: I should of spent more, I was replacing a phillips system hit by lightning, thesis system, has a bad mix of speakers, cheap, not good at all neg stars if possible, Reviews are very bad use mine it's at least honest !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nobody special

customer_reviews.title: Good value for a computer speaker set up.
customer_reviews.text: I had a 5.1 surround sound system for my stereo (also Logitech) that lasted 12 years before a speaker died. I bought this item to be a replacement.... totally satisfied. Great sound for movies / gaming etc. Very good value. I expect it to last a LONG time since my last Logitech sound system did.
customer_reviews.author: Helomech

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: It won't stand up to a $300 pair of headphones but it's an excellent product for the price. It leaves something to be desired in the mid-range and it would be nice to have bass control next to the volume control on the right speaker (rather than on the bass itself). No other complaints, it will BOOM without distortion. Everything feels durable. The control-knobs have the perfect amount of resistance. Volume knob, headphone jack and audio input jack on the right speaker.
customer_reviews.author: mleotten

customer_reviews.title: They don't make them like they used to anymore
customer_reviews.text: They don't make them like they used to anymore. I have a pair of Z-3s and they are going strong. Comparatively, the Z323 just doesn't sound as crisp as the Z-3s. I was very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: Sure, they look dated and I wish they were smaller, but the sound on these is pretty good. VERY good, when compared to our Echo (which I do like but the sound quality is just so bad, especially when you turn it up.) They get pretty loud and don't crackle or rattle. The clarity is not perfect, but they were inexpensive. So, perfection was not expected. I am happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Bell

customer_reviews.title: Bass??! What bass !?
customer_reviews.text: Its like it had NO bass. Im not a bass head by no means...but I want to know ITS THERE! Its as tho the subwoofer was non existent. Sent back.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Owner 3

customer_reviews.title: Sadly, I regret my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I'm actually very disappointed in these speakers. They don't do two channel sound (left and right) but insist on playing everything from both. The bass is absolute garbage. If my Altec Lansing speakers weren't busted, I'd send this back. I love logitech products but I'm guessing they don't do speakers well.
customer_reviews.author: Mikel Finley

customer_reviews.title: Great sound at a great price
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for great sound on a budget, this is your speaker set. I was skeptical at first but from the moment I set this up for my new PC build, I've been super impressed. Plug and play, easy bass controls, sounds fantastic with minimal effort. Would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Tsukiakari

customer_reviews.title: 6 months and they're junk
customer_reviews.text: Worked well, sound quality was great. Hit the 6 month mark approximately, and the right speaker went to junk. Sound is muffled and garbled.
customer_reviews.author: NOber

customer_reviews.title: This would be fine except for when watching anything movies I have to ...
customer_reviews.text: They are loud enough but the sound is not particularly clear. This would be fine except for when watching anything movies I have to turn the volume up to understand dialogue which means other scenes are too loud. Also the volume know does absolutely nothing for 90% if it’s rotation. All of the volume range is within a tiny fraction of the turn so trying to get the volume right is tricky as it’s so sensitive within that range. If you just want these for playing music fairly loudly in your room, they’re fine.
customer_reviews.author: E.S. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Will not buy again
customer_reviews.text: 3 sets of these and the left speaker has gone on all of them. I even tried to buy a left speaker to replace one and all I got was a runaround from logitech ! ( Not Amazon they did there Part) Will not buy these again !
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 3 Months - UPDATED  TRUSTING THE BRAND, BOUGHT THEM AGAIN
customer_reviews.text: This product lasted only 3 months and the jack that plugs into the source split and this is now unusable. Not happy at all. NOW I AM JUST PLAIN FLAT PISSED OFF!!!!! I USED TO TRUST LOGITECH, BUT NOT ANYMORE! AFTER REPLACING THE SPEAKER SET WITH THE SAME SYSTEM.....THE VERY SAME PROBLEM HAPPENED AGAIN!! THE JACK THAT PLUGS INTO THE SOUND SOURCE IN THE COMPUTER PULLS APART AND THE SYSTEM IS BROKE AGAIN. DO NOT BUY THE LOGITECH Z323 SPEAKER SYSTEM!! AMAZON, HOW ABOUT A LITTLE HELP ON THIS POORLY MANUFACTURED JUNK.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These by far are the worst speakers I have ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: These by far are the worst speakers I have ever purchased. The cracking and farting sounds are annoying on the slightest move of the desk. The problem started about 3-days after install. I unplug these and tried a friends speakers and they worked fine which appears to be an issue with the jacks. I really hate slamming Logitec but would highly NOT recommend this set and should move on. This was money right to the toilet. I guess it is back to my headphones for the time being til I find something else. Grrrrrrr
customer_reviews.author: MediaMan

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace my old speakers for my PC. After reading many reviews on various speakers...I settled on these. It's pretty decent...I'm happy with my purchase & was very easy to hook up...there were a lot less wires to hook up than my old set. Arrived early & was very well packaged.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

product_meta.title: Logitech Speaker System Z323 with Subwoofer
product_meta.description: Style:NewTransport yourself into your music, movies and games with the 30-watt (RMS) Logitech Speaker System Z323. With 360-degree sound, the Z323 speakers help project audio evenly in all directions, so you get a great listening experience throughout the room. 1 dual RCA jack and a 3.5 mm jack make it easy to connect your gaming console, DVD player or iPod. System requirements: Television Computer Smartphone Tablet Music playerDVD playerBlu-ray player PlayStation Xbox Wii|Television|Computer|Smartphone|Tablet|Music player|DVD player|Blu-ray player|PlayStation|Xbox|Wii
feature_bullets: Immersive Logitech 360-degree sound for crystal-clear, room-filling audio
Ported, down-firing subwoofer delivers deep, rich bass. Satellites(height x width x depth): 8.3 x 3.4 x 4.5 inches
RCA and 3.5 millimeter inputs for easy connections to gaming console, DVD player or iPod
30 Watt (RMS) of power produces big, bold full-range sound
Integrated headphone jack for private listening. Subwoofer - 18W. Total watts (RMS) - 30W

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,907 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
